edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface.infrastructure
Class FileSystemHandler

java.lang.Object
  edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface.infrastructure.FileSystemHandler

public class FileSystemHandler
extends Object

A class to handle all the filesystem interactions in the Hadoop interface.

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a file system handler.

Constructs a file system handler

Parameters:

Method Detail

setUpIODirectories

public void setUpIODirectories()
                        throws IOException
Sets up the input and output directories for this job in the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Throws:
IOException - Possible IOException from file operations

checkFileSystem

public void checkFileSystem()
                     throws IOException
Confirms that the required directories exist (or don't exist, as the case may be) and that we have valid inputs, and throws an IO Exception if we do not. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction.

Throws:
IOException - Possible IOException from file operations

cleanUpTempFiles

public void cleanUpTempFiles()
                      throws IOException
Removes the temp directory used by HadoopInterface

Throws:
IOException

delete

public void delete(Path fileOrDirectoryToDelete)
            throws IOException
Deletes a file or directory from this object's file system.

Parameters:
fileOrDirectoryToDelete - The location of the thing to be deleted. If this is a directory, we will perform a recursive delete (deleting all files within the directory as well).
Throws:
IOException

deleteLocal

public static void deleteLocal(Path fileOrDirectoryToDelete)
                        throws IOException
Deletes a file or directory from the local file system

Parameters:
fileOrDirectoryToDelete - The location of the thing to be deleted. If this is a directory, we will perform a recursive delete (deleting all files within the directory as well).
Throws:
IOException

mkdir

public void mkdir(Path directoryToCreate)
           throws IOException
Creates a directory with read/write access to anyone (777 permissions). For our purposes, this is fine. If the directory already exists, we simply exit---it's up to you to make sure you're giving a good path. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
directoryToCreate - A path to the location where the directory should be created.
Throws:
IOException

mkdirLocal

public static void mkdirLocal(Path directoryToCreate)
                       throws IOException
Creates a directory on the local file system with 777 permissions. For our purposes, this is fine. If the directory already exists, we simply exit---it's up to you to make sure you're giving a good path.

Parameters:
directoryToCreate - A path to the location where the directory should be created.
Throws:
IOException

getFileNameFromPath

public static String getFileNameFromPath(Path p)
Returns the filename from a path. For instance, if p was /foo/bar/bas.txt, it would return "bas.txt".

Parameters:
p - A path that ends in a file
Returns:
The final path component

getFileNameWithoutExtension

public static String getFileNameWithoutExtension(Path p)
Returns the file name without its extension from a path. For instance, if p was /foo/bar/bas.txt, this would return "bas".

Parameters:
p - A path that ends in a file
Returns:
The file's name, without its extension

readFileFromLocal

public static String readFileFromLocal(Path locationOfFile)
                                throws IOException
Returns a string version of a file on the local file system (i.e., not in the Hadoop Distributed File System).

Parameters:
locationOfFile - The path of the file to be read
Returns:
A string version of the requested file
Throws:
IOException

writeFileToHDFS

public void writeFileToHDFS(String inputText,
                            Path locationForFile)
                     throws IOException
Writes a string to a text file to a given location on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). Note that this will overwrite anything currently present at the location. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given. Takes String. Defaults to override mode.

Parameters:
inputText - The string to be written to the text file
locationForFile - A path (complete with file name and extension) to which we should write. If data already exists at this location, it will be overwritten.
Throws:
IOException

writeFileToHDFS

public void writeFileToHDFS(String inputText,
                            Path locationForFile,
                            boolean appendInsteadOfOverwriting)
                     throws IOException
Writes a string to a text file to a given location on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). Note that this is not thread-safe; Hadoop recommends you not try to have multiple nodes writing to the same file, ever. Takes String. Specifies append/overwrite mode.

Parameters:
inputText - The string to be written to the text file
locationForFile - A path (complete with file name and extension) to which we should write. If data already exists at this location, it will be overwritten.
appendInsteadOfOverwriting - TRUE if we should append to whatever currently exists at the location, FALSE if it is okay to overwrite it.
Throws:
IOException

writeBytesToHDFS

public void writeBytesToHDFS(byte[] input,
                             Path locationForFile)
                      throws IOException
Writes a byte array to a text file to a given location on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). Note that this will overwrite anything currently present at the location. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given. Takes byte[]. Defaults to overwrite mode.

Parameters:
input - The byte array to be written to the text file
locationForFile - A path (complete with file name and extension) to which we should write. If data already exists at this location, it will be overwritten.
Throws:
IOException

writeBytesToHDFS

public void writeBytesToHDFS(byte[] input,
                             Path locationForFile,
                             boolean appendInsteadOfOverwriting)
                      throws IOException
Writes a byte array to a text file to a given location on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). Note that this is not thread-safe; Hadoop recommends you not try to have multiple nodes writing to the same file, ever. Takes byte[]. Specifies append/overwrite mode.

Parameters:
input - The byte array to be written to the text file
locationForFile - A path (complete with file name and extension) to which we should write. If data already exists at this location, it will be overwritten.
appendInsteadOfOverwriting - TRUE if we should append to whatever currently exists at the location, FALSE if it is okay to overwrite it.
Throws:
IOException

writeFileToLocal

public void writeFileToLocal(String inputText,
                             Path locationForFile)
                      throws IOException
Writes a string to a specified file on the local (i.e., non-Hadoop Distributed) file system. Note that this method overwrites any data previously present in the requested location.

Parameters:
inputText - The string to be written to the file
locationForFile - A path indicating where on the local disk the data should be written
Throws:
IOException

writeFileToLocal

public static void writeFileToLocal(String inputText,
                                    Path locationForFile,
                                    boolean appendInsteadOfOverwriting)
                             throws IOException
Writes a string to a specified file on the local (i.e., non-Hadoop Distributed) file system.

Parameters:
inputText - The string to be written to the file
locationForFile - A path indicating where on the local disk the data should be written
appendInsteadOfOverwriting - TRUE if we should append to whatever currently exists at the location, FALSE if it is okay to overwrite it.
Throws:
IOException

copyFileFromLocalToHDFS

public void copyFileFromLocalToHDFS(Path inLocalFileSystem,
                                    Path inHDFS)
                             throws IOException
Copies a file from the local file system into HDFS. Resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
inLocalFileSystem - The file in the local file system to be written to HDFS.
inHDFS - The location of the file to be written to. This will contain a copy of the file in the local file system.
Throws:
IOException

copyFileFromHDFSToLocal

public void copyFileFromHDFSToLocal(Path inHDFS,
                                    Path inLocalFileSystem)
                             throws IOException
Copies a file from HDFS to the local file system. Resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
inHDFS - The location of the file in HDFS that will be copied to the local file system.
inLocalFileSystem - The file in the local file system that will contain a copy of the file in HDFS.
Throws:
IOException

getFilesAndDirectoriesInDirectory

public List<String> getFilesAndDirectoriesInDirectory(Path dir)
                                               throws IOException
Returns an array of strings naming the files and directories in the directory denoted by this abstract path name. Resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given. There is no guarantee that the name strings in the resulting array will appear in any specific order; they are not, in particular, guaranteed to appear in alphabetical order.

Parameters:
dir - The path whose files you want a list of
Returns:
A list of all files and sub-directories found in the directory
Throws:
IOException

getSubdirectories

public List<Path> getSubdirectories(Path dir)
                             throws IOException
Gets a list of Paths that contains all subdirectories in the directory in question. Resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
dir - The directory whose subdirectories we shall get the list of.
Returns:
A list of Paths which point to the subdirectories of the input directory.
Throws:
IOException

localFileExists

public static boolean localFileExists(Path fileLocation)
Returns TRUE if the file exists at the specified path, and false otherwise.

Parameters:
fileLocation - A Path to the file in question
Returns:
TRUE if and only if the specified file exists.

HDFSFileExists

public boolean HDFSFileExists(Path fileLocation)
                       throws IOException
Returns TRUE if the file exists at the specified path, and false otherwise. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
fileLocation - A Path to the file in question
Returns:
TRUE if and only if the specified file exists.
Throws:
IOException

isDir

public boolean isDir(Path path)
              throws IOException
Checks whether a given path refers to a directory. Note that the path does *not* need to actually exist---if the file is not found, we simply return false. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
path - The location of the file/directory in question
Returns:
True if path points to a directory, false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

fileWasModifiedInLastXMins

public boolean fileWasModifiedInLastXMins(Path path,
                                          int minutes)
                                   throws IOException
Checks the file to see if it was modified in the last (some number) minutes. This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
path - The location (file or directory) whose last modification time we should check
minutes - The max allowed number of minutes since the last modification
Returns:
True if the file was modified within the last (parameter: minutes) minutes.
Throws:
IOException

getFileSizeInBytes

public long getFileSizeInBytes(Path path)
                        throws IOException
Returns the size of the indicated file, in bytes This method resolves paths using the file system object given to this object during its construction, or created based on the Curator job configuration it was given.

Parameters:
path - The location of the file in question. Note that if this is a directory, you'll get the size of the actual Unix file representing the directory, *not* the size of the sum of the contents.
Returns:
The size in bytes of the entity at the indicated path
Throws:
IOException

stripTrailingSlash

public static String stripTrailingSlash(Path p)
Removes a trailing slash from a path, if it exists.

Parameters:
p - The path whose (possibly nonexistent) trailing slash you want to remove
Returns:
The path with no trailing slash
